subject: Design
title: Affordances: Designs That Tell You What to Do
description: Learn Affordances: Designs That Tell You What to Do in one minute.

hook.text: A chair affords sitting. A button affords pressing. Good design tells you what to do without words.

buildup.text: James Gibson coined 'affordance' in 1977 â€” the properties of an object that suggest its use.

discovery.text: Norman brought affordances to design: flat plates on doors say push, handles say pull.

twist.text: Digital design struggles with affordances â€” a flat blue rectangle doesn't obviously scream 'click me.'

climax.text: Skeuomorphism (making digital things look real) was one solution. Flat design challenged it.

punchline.text: Every design whispers instructions. Great design whispers clearly.

quiz.question: What is an affordance in design?
options: A visual cue suggesting how to use something
